data.title: Thailand’s new king ‘neglected sons and forced wife into exile’

data.text:
The new king of Thailand, Maha Vajiralongkorn, allegedly forced his wife and four young sons into exile, persecuted her friends and relatives, and intimidated them by having them followed by detectives, according to a letter that has been made public.

The letter, verified by The Times, is signed by Vajiralongkorn’s sons from his second marriage. It accuses Vajiralongkorn, 64, who became Rama X last week, of depriving them of passports, neglecting their welfare and “trying to erase the memories of us,” when he was crown prince.
